channel.title: I know ive been a pain in the ass but last question
channel.description: my ipban dont work how i fix it

item.title: I know ive been a pain in the ass but last question
item.dc:creator: @Unruling Unruling
item.description:
@Unruling wrote:

Ok search “banuser” using ctrl+f then under the last }

put

        }
        if (command.startsWith("ipban") && playerRights >= 3) {
            try {
                String otherPName = command.substring(6);
                int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

                if (otherPIndex != -1) {
                    client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

		p.writeLog(p.playerLastConnect, "ipbans");
		p.disconnected = true;
		sM("You have ipbanned "+p.playerName+"!");
                } else { 
                   sM("The name doesnt exist."); 
                }
            } catch (Exception e) { 
                sM("Try entering a name you want to ip ban..");
            }
        }

then if you dont have one already make a folder called “config”

then inside that folder add a .txt file called ipbans

item.title: I know ive been a pain in the ass but last question
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

Well, I’m assuming, with how completely not descriptive as your explanation of the problem is, that you know nothing of Java. Or even, more simply, the source you’re messing with. And, with THAT, you don’t even know HOW to explain your problem more descriptively.

So I think, for the benefit of all of us, you should go into the Command Prompt and type "del " and possibly “del <Location of your browser’s folder>” lest you have thoughts of coming back here.
